member.name: T:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump
member.summary: Interface to dbghelp.dll:MiniDumpWriteDump function

member.name: F:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.Normal
member.summary: Include just the information necessary to capture stack traces for all existing threads in a process.

member.name: F:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.WithDataSegments
member.summary: Include the data sections from all loaded modules. This results in the inclusion of global variables, which can make the minidump file significantly larger. For per-module control, use the ModuleWriteDataSeg enumeration value from MODULE_WRITE_FLAGS.

member.name: F:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.WithFullMemory
member.summary: Include all accessible memory in the process. The raw memory data is included at the end, so that the initial structures can be mapped directly without the raw memory information. This option can result in a very large file.

member.name: F:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.WithHandleData
member.summary: Include high-level information about the operating system handles that are active when the minidump is made.

member.name: F:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.FilterMemory
member.summary: Stack and backing store memory written to the minidump file should be filtered to remove all but the pointer values necessary to reconstruct a stack trace.

member.name: F:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.ScanMemory
member.summary: Stack and backing store memory should be scanned for pointer references to modules in the module list. If a module is referenced by stack or backing store memory, the ModuleWriteFlags member of the MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_OUTPUT structure is set to ModuleReferencedByMemory.

member.name: F:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.WithUnloadedModules
member.summary:
Include information from the list of modules that were recently unloaded, if this information is maintained by the operating system.
Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: The operating system does not maintain information for unloaded modules until Windows Server 2003 with SP1 and Windows XP with SP2.
DbgHelp 5.1: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.WithIndirectlyReferencedMemory
member.summary:
Include pages with data referenced by locals or other stack memory. This option can increase the size of the minidump file significantly.
DbgHelp 5.1: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.FilterModulePaths
member.summary:
Filter module paths for information such as user names or important directories. This option may prevent the system from locating the image file and should be used only in special situations.
DbgHelp 5.1: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.WithProcessThreadData
member.summary:
Include complete per-process and per-thread information from the operating system.
DbgHelp 5.1: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.WithPrivateReadWriteMemory
member.summary:
Scan the virtual address space for PAGE_READWRITE memory to be included.
DbgHelp 5.1: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.WithoutOptionalData
member.summary:
Reduce the data that is dumped by eliminating memory regions that are not essential to meet criteria specified for the dump. This can avoid dumping memory that may contain data that is private to the user. However, it is not a guarantee that no private information will be present.
DbgHelp 6.1 and earlier: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.WithFullMemoryInfo
member.summary:
Include memory region information. For more information, see MINIDUMP_MEMORY_INFO_LIST.
DbgHelp 6.1 and earlier: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.WithThreadInfo
member.summary:
Include thread state information. For more information, see MINIDUMP_THREAD_INFO_LIST.
DbgHelp 6.1 and earlier: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.WithCodeSegments
member.summary:
Include all code and code-related sections from loaded modules to capture executable content. For per-module control, use the ModuleWriteCodeSegs enumeration value from MODULE_WRITE_FLAGS.
DbgHelp 6.1 and earlier: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.WithoutAuxiliaryState
member.summary: Turns off secondary auxiliary-supported memory gathering.

member.name: F:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.WithFullAuxiliaryState
member.summary: Requests that auxiliary data providers include their state in the dump image; the state data that is included is provider dependent. This option can result in a large dump image.

member.name: F:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.WithPrivateWriteCopyMemory
member.summary:
Scans the virtual address space for PAGE_WRITECOPY memory to be included.
Prior to DbgHelp 6.1: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.IgnoreInaccessibleMemory
member.summary:
If you specify MiniDumpWithFullMemory, the MiniDumpWriteDump function will fail if the function cannot read the memory regions; however, if you include MiniDumpIgnoreInaccessibleMemory, the MiniDumpWriteDump function will ignore the memory read failures and continue to generate the dump. Note that the inaccessible memory regions are not included in the dump.
Prior to DbgHelp 6.1: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.WithTokenInformation
member.summary:
Adds security token related data. This will make the "!token" extension work when processing a user-mode dump.
Prior to DbgHelp 6.1: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.WithModuleHeaders
member.summary:
Adds module header related data.
Prior to DbgHelp 6.1: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.FilterTriage
member.summary:
Adds filter triage related data.
Prior to DbgHelp 6.1: This value is not supported.

member.name: M:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.Create(System.String)
member.summary: Dumps the current process to the specified file.

member.name: M:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.MiniDump.Create(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Dumps the current process to the specified file.
member.param: The flags that are passed to create the dump file (from the constants above).

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The base log file name. This should include the path, filename and extension - the current file index will be appended before the extension
Maximum size of a single log file, in kilobytes.
The maximum number of current log files to keep.
The number of old generations of log file to keep.

member.name: P:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.LogFileTarget.FileName
member.summary: The base filename to use for log files, including path and extension. The log file index will be appended to the file name before the extension e.g. MyLog_001.log

member.name: P:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.LogFileTarget.MaximumFileSize
member.summary: The maximum size of a single log file, in kilobytes. When this is reached, the file is closed and a new file is opened with the next index. If set to 0, then there is no maximum size for a log file.

member.name: P:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.LogFileTarget.MaximumCurrentFiles
member.summary: The maximum number of files to keep for the current log run. Once this is reached, the oldest file is deleted. E.g. If this is set to five, when file MyLog_006.log is opened, then MyLog_001.log will be deleted. If set to 0, then all files will be kept.

member.name: P:SchneiderElectric.Common.Util.LogFileTarget.MaximumOldGenerations
member.summary: The maximum number of generations of log files to keep. When logging is initialized, files from a previous run will be renamed with a _2 suffix, the previous previous run will be renamed with a _3 suffix, etc. The set of files with the oldest suffix will be deleted.

member.summary: Closes the target and releases any unmanaged resources.
